document_data.name: Bear Tribe
document_data.mainbody: The '''bear tribe''' was part of the [[Azuposi]] nation of the [[Pasocada Basin]] of northern [[Maztica]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Base of Operations: In addition to inhabiting the Pasocada Basin, the bear tribe maintained a center near the heart of [[Michaca]], the City of Gold.
document_data.History: The bear tribe was one of six separate tribes that composed the Azuposi people. They represented the southwest direction on the compass and their sacred animal was the [[bear]].
